did.head: Descriptive Summary
did.unittitle: Mathews County (Va.) Tax and Fiscal Records, 1854-1903

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Mathews County (Va.) Tax and Fiscal Records, 1854-1903. Local government records collection, Mathews County Court Records. The Library of Virginia, Richmond, Va. 23219.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: These items came to the Library of Virginia in shipments of court papers from Mathews County.

bioghist.head: Historical Information
bioghist.p: Mathews County was named for Thomas Mathews, of Norfolk, the Speaker of the Virginia House of Delegates in 1790 when the county was formed from Gloucester County.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Mathews County (Va.) Tax and Fiscal Records, 1854-1903 consist of Commonwealth claims, 1866-1903; County bonds, 1894; County claims, 1859-1894; Delinquent land lists, 1871-1887; Delinquent tax lists, 1876; Licenses, 1866-1900; Liquor bonds, 1877-1881; Oyster law taxes, 1892, 1897; Requests for reassessments, 1888-1899; Sheriff's accounts, 1854-1869, 1902; Tax exemptions, 1890, 1897; and Treasurer's records, 1874, 1886-1895.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Arranged alphabetically by subject and then chronologically.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Material
relatedmaterial.p: Additional Mathews County Tax and Fiscal Records can be found on microfilm at the Library of Virginia. Consult "A Guide to Virginia County and City Records on Microfilm"

Mathews County is one of Virginia's Lost Records Localities. Additional Mathews County Court Records may be found in the Virginia Lost Records Localities Collection at the Library of Virginia. Search the Lost Records Localities Database found at the Library of Virginia web site.
